alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 5:30AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS EXPECTED FOR THE UPPER HILLSIDE OF ANCHORAGE, TURNAGAIN ARM, AND PORTAGE VALLEY SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... Southeasterly winds will be on the increase beginning late Saturday afternoon as a strong, fall-like storm system moves toward the western Gulf of Alaska. These winds are expected to continue to increase through the overnight hours, peaking Sunday morning, as a frontal system moves into Prince William Sound. The winds are then expected to slowly diminish through Sunday afternoon and evening; however, it will continue to remain breezy through Turnagain Arm into early Monday morning. Sustained winds of 25 to 40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph are expected late Saturday night through Sunday morning through Turnagain Arm and Portage Valley. Winds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 55 mph are expected for the Upper Hillside of Anchorage. High profile vehicles traveling the Seward Highway corridor through Turnagain Arm Saturday afternoon through Sunday should use extra caution as wind gusts could be very strong and erratic. Up to 2 inches of rain is also possible Saturday night through Sunday for Portage Valley. The combination of steady rain and strong winds may make for difficult driving conditions at times. For more information and for your local forecast, please visit weather.gov/Anchorage.
